p: To analyze the importance of the plants mentioned in the interviews, we used their frequency of citations and the Smith salience index given by Σ((( Li − Rj)/Li)100)/ N, where Li is the size of the free listing, Rj is the position (order) of the item in a given free list ( Li), and N is the total number of free listings (or the number of interviewees) [ 50]. We also considered that the first item of a given list has Rj = 0. This index ranges from 0 to 1; species with a value equal to or close to 1 are the species with the highest salience, and species with values close to 0 are the least salient. After assessing the Smith salience index, we calculated if the values differed by chance using a Monte Carlo analysis, following Chaves et al. [ 58].
